summary: Ever since I was a kid, people have asked me what I want to do as I get older. I remember my first answer was always the same:...
body: Ever since I was a kid, people have asked me what I want to do as I get older. I remember my first answer was always the same: never an astronaut, a rockstar; not even the president of the United States. I wanted to be Spider-Man! It took me almost 25 years to get my first suit, but the release of Avengers: Infinity War last year sealed the deal. Here are some photos from the first night I got my Iron Spider suit!

title: One Of A Kind
body:
Pairing: Peter Parker x fem!Reader

Word Count: ~2700

Warnings: Alcohol consumption. First kiss. 

(A/N): Still not dead, but getting there.

Summary: Let’s get drunk together so I can kiss you and then blame it on the vodka

“Oh, there we go again,” Ned sighs, watching Peter zone out and zero in on you. 

There was just something in the lighting surrounding you in that moment, that just caught his eye. 

The sunlight seemed to be hitting your face perfectly, framing your angled features in a ridiculously flattering way. 

Your skin looked warm to the touch, almost as if it was glowing, and he’d be lying if he said didn’t have the urge to stroke along your cheek, if only to test that theory. And, oh, your eyes. Still ever so effortlessly breathtaking and captivating. He wasn’t honestly sure if being that attractive was legal, let alone allowed on school premises.

He knew he was staring at you, but you didn’t seem bothered. You only propped your head on your fist, elbow resting on the table. And then you send him a lazy smile and amused little wink, taking his staring in stride before turning back to your companions at your table.

“Peter,” Ned sighs, clearing his throat, “Earth to Peter.” He waves his hand in front of the boy’s face, finally catching his attention. 

“Glad to see you’ve decided to join me in the present realm, buddy.”

Peter’s eyes widen momentarily, then he forcefully tears his eyes from you and the other cheerleaders and faces Ned. 

“Sorry, could you repeat that?”

“Which part? You were gone for like ten minutes.”

He makes a show of shoving Ned, snorting as Ned pushes him back with equal force.

“Anyway,” Ned clears his throat and moves to stand, motioning for Peter to do the same, “I was asking whether you were going to the party?”

“What party?” Peter furrows his brows, gripping at his bag and following Ned out the cafeteria. 

“Seriously?” The boy turns to send Peter an incredulous look over his shoulder. 

Peter nods, “Yes, that is the reason why you can hear confusion in my voice.” He motions to his face for emphasis. 

“Krista’s party? The one everyone was talking about for weeks? Does that ring a bell?”

“No?”

“You’re unbelievable.”

Peter shrugs, “I wasn’t going to go anyway.”

“Really? You were really going to miss the chance to spend some time with your sweet cheer-captain? That’s hard to-”

“She’s gonna be there?”

“Wow,” he shakes his head, “don’t even try to hide it, that’s cool,” a sigh and another shake of his head, “of course she’s going to be there. Everyone cooler than thou will. So, you going?”

“Well,” he rubs at the back of his neck, “a couple of hours wouldn’t hurt, would they?”

Ned grins, “and here I thought it’d be hard to change your mind.”

“Ok. Maybe coming here wasn’t such a good idea after all,” Peter gulps, hands reaching out to fumble at the collar of his jacket for the hundredth time in the past 5 minutes. 

Ned simply rolls his eyes, “Relax." 

"But-”

“No buts,” he pushes a drink into Peter’s hands, shoving him back towards the crowded living room, he gives up in the doorway, “you’ll be fine.”

“But she’s not here anyway and I really need to do my physics homework and-”

“You’re rambling. And she’s gonna show up. You know how her boyfriend is, he’s going to make a show of arriving late with her on his arm.”

“You know, reminding me of her boyfriend doesn’t help much.”

“Well, someone has to.”

“But-”

“You know what they say about the devil?” Ned motions to the door, watching as you appear in the doorway, your boyfriend straight behind you, shamelessly watching your ass. 

He isn’t the only one staring, but you take it all in stride once more, lips quirking into a smile. 

You give off the air of a queen then, charming and so unfairly gorgeous. No wonder people always seemed to flock to you.

And then you’re placing a chaste kiss onto your boyfriend’s cheek and walking towards the kitchen, towards him. 

You stop a few feet in front of Peter, smiling still.

And he wants to speak, to make everything less awkward, but what is he going to say? 

You look gorgeous? That would be stating the obvious. Something you must’ve heard at least a hundred times already today.

Something funny? Charming? Mr. Stark would be.

You arch a brow at him, smile curling into an amused little smirk, watching him open his mouth and close it again when nothing comes out. 

He falters for a moment, seemingly lost in thought and you can’t help but find it somewhat cute.

Great. He hasn’t even spoken to you yet and he’s already tongue tied.

“Hello- Uh, hi.” He manages finally, raising his hand and offering you an awkward little wave. “So,” he clears his throat, fumbling with his hands, “Come here often?”

His eyes widen slightly. Come here often? He wants to slap himself.

You snort- why is that so cute- and he feels like dying. Melting into the dirtied kitchen floor and evaporating into the atmosphere sounded great right about then.

“The kitchen? Why yes, whenever I want a drink.”

“The ki-” he turns his head so fast you’re surprised he doesn’t get a whiplash, noticing with horror that he’s been blocking the closest entry for the entire time, “Oh, I’m sorry! I didn’t-”

“I’m sure you didn’t,” you smile at him in a way that makes the sun look dull, it’s contagious. “Relax, Peter. You’ll live longer.”

And with that you move past him and into the kitchen, completely missing how Peter’s own smile stretches to an almost impossible length.

“Still wanna leave?” Ned quips from behind Peter, watching his best friend turn to face him with a grin of his own.

Peter ignores his question completely. “She knows my name!” His eyes widen as if he’s only now starting to fully register that fact. “How does- she knows my name!”

His hands rise to rest on his hair, an elated laugh escaping his lips. He’s sure Ned can hear his heart hammering against his rib cage over the booming music.

“She sure does,” Ned supplies amusedly, reaching out to switch out Peter’s cup with his own, “So, staying then?”

Peter nods, watching Ned outstretch his arm and meeting him halfway, clinking their plastic cups together. 

“Sweet cheeks, truth or dare?”

Flash smirks from the corner of the couch he stands leaning against. 

“Dare,” you smirk back, downing the remains of your cup, gladly accepting another one from one of the newer members of your cheer team. 

“I dare you,” Flash pauses, brows twitching in careful consideration before his eyes light up, “I dare you,” he repeats louder, more sure, “to get rid of your shirt and walk around in a bra for the rest of the party!”

Wolf whistles and cheers follow his dare and you roll your eyes, smirking still. 

“How do you know I’m even wearing a bra?” You arch a brow and watch Flash choke on his drink, some chuckles and giggles following your reply. 

Nevertheless, you give your cup to the closest jock for him to hold, fingers tugging at your shirt to pull it over your head. 

You throw it in Flash’s face, more whistles and laughter following as you reach for your cup again. 

“Alright, my turn.” You lick your lips and look around the room, eyes halting on Peter for a second, then two. Then two more, before moving on and stopping on your boyfriend. 

“Dear,” you begin teasingly, “truth or dare?”

“Dare,” he smirks, chugging down his own beverage before accepting a new bottle of beer from one of the jocks. 

“I dare you,” you allow one of the jocks to lean in and whisper something into your ear, “Sure,” you agree, “I dare you to strip and run a round around the block.”

His eyes light up with something akin to amusement? Peter’s not sure anymore in his own slightly buzzed state, and he begins stripping, stopping when he’s only in his boxers. 

“Completely?”

“Nah,” you wave him off, “wouldn’t want you to surrender your last shards of dignity so soon.”

He grins and marches to the door, confidently swinging it open and saluting before setting into a wobbly jog. 

“Well,” Flash grins, “who’s next?”

“Hey, have you seen-”

“Upstairs,” Ned motions up, smiling knowingly. 

“With-”

“No. I think he got lost. Maybe found a bush to sleep in?”

Peter nods, brows creasing in worry. “Is she alright?”

“Why wouldn’t she be?”

“Well, she’s been gone for pretty long.”

“Wow,” Ned raises his brows, “don’t even try to seem not totally creepy. Love it.”

Peter ignores his quip, repositioning the bottle of booze under his arm. “Maybe I should check on her?”

Ned shrugs, “You do you, bud.”

“I’m going.”

“Have fun.”

Peter nods absently, slowly pushing past the various party goers and wobbly making his way up the stairs. 

He doesn’t find you in the first two bedrooms, going for the third when he notices the open window to his left.

He steps forward and peeks outside, finding you sitting on the roof, looking at the stars. 

“Hey-” You turn to face him, and he falters for a moment, “Uh, would you like some company?”

“Sure,” you smile at him and he returns the gesture, carefully climbing out the window and joining you on the roof. 

“What are you doing on the roof anyway?”

“I wanted to get some fresh air.”

“On the roof?”

“Yup.” You pop the ‘p’ and Peter chuckles, a rush of hot affection bubbling up, wrapping itself around his heart, and he smiles. Of course, you did. 

“Well, it is beautiful.” He sneaks a quick look at you and watches your own smile widen in agreement. 

“Yeah, it is.”

Comfortable silence settles between the two of you, Peter occasionally shifting his eyes to your form whenever you decide to mouth along to the lyrics of whatever song is playing in the background.

“Hey, let’s play a game,” you pipe up after a while, suddenly turning and sitting cross-legged to face him directly. 

“A game?”

You giggle, and the sound makes something clench in his chest, not unpleasant, but noticeable and new. “That’s what I said.”

He answers with a smile, “What kind of game?”

“Never have I ever?“

"Never have I ever?” He repeats slowly, startling when you reach for his arm to take the bottle of cheap whiskey he took with.

“Yes,” you confirm, “you say something that you’ve never done and if I have done it, I’ll have to take a shot.”

“Here,” you open the now lukewarm bottle and smile, “I’ll go first. Never have I ever stolen something from a shop.”

“I’ve never.”

“Congratulations. Your turn.”

“Never have I ever,” he wrinkles his nose, eyes lighting up with an idea, “Never have I ever met anyone greater than Tony Stark.”

You huff incredulously, taking a big gulp. “You have met Tony Stark? Really?”

Peter nods enthusiastically. “Yeah, Mr. Stark and I worked together a couple of times. He’s awesome!”

“No doubt about that,” you agree. “Ok, my turn. Never have I ever gone skinny-dipping.”

“Never.”

“Somehow, not even surprised.”

“Never have I ever cheated on a test.”

“Wow, lay it on me,” you chuckle, taking another drink.

“Ok. Never have I ever jumped from a roof.”

Peter sheepishly reaches for the bottle, taking a big gulp.

“Seriously?” You wrinkle your nose at him.

“Hmm.”

“You’ll have to tell me about it sometime.”

Peter bites the inside of his cheek to keep from smiling too hard at the mention of a next time.

“Never have I ever driven while drunk.”

“Nope. I have never,” you raise your hands with a glint in your eyes, “and quite frankly I’m insulted you’d even think you’d get me with that.”

Peter chuckles bashfully.

“Ok. Hmm. Never have I ever been given a jacket when I was cold.”

“Are you cold?”

“Kinda?”

He drapes his jacket over you, smiling at you in his cute dopey way at the way the sleeves are far too big and you just kind of sink into it.

“Now you have.”

“You’re sweet.“

So are you. Somehow, he has enough self-awareness to not voice his thoughts out loud. So, instead, he takes a shot.

“It’s your turn.”

“Right,” he clears his throat, cheeks flushing, “never have I ever been kissed.”

Your eyebrows rise, and it may be the alcohol talking but goddamn you look even more stunning when you lean forward and pout in confusion. “Never?”

“Never.” He admits and the smile that follows takes his breath away. 

"Gotta say, I’m surprised.”

“Why?”

You shrug, taking a gulp. “I just thought someone as nice as you would have girls throwing themselves at him.” And after a beat, “And you’re pretty cute, you know?”

“Oh?” He’s flushed pink, unsure what to say. Heart hammering loud enough for you to hear it. He’s sure of it.

“Well,” you slowly crawl closer, reaching out to place a cool hand onto his cheek and turning his head to face you entirely, “it’s nothing that can’t be fixed.”

Does she mean-?

His eyes flutter shut when you lean in and kiss him, his hand cupping your jaw in a much too tender way. 

Oh, she does. And then all other semi-coherent thoughts leave him and he relaxes, feeling you smile against his mouth.

Your lips make his whole body feel warm, like he is sitting directly next to the sun. Your hand on his jaw feels cool though and the contrast is oddly intoxicating.

Your lips move against his smoothly, expertly, wonderfully. His trying to copy your motions, eager to learn. There’s no tongue- there’s nothing inherently sexual about the situation- but his heart is pounding, and his stomach is full of butterflies. 

He’s sure he’s blushing like mad by now and this time it has absolutely nothing to do with embarrassment. 

And then you’re gripping at the collar of his shirt and drawing him closer, dragging your thumb over cheek before releasing him from your spell and leaning back.

“Here you go,” you grin, “now you have.”

The rest of the night goes by in a blur, but it’s the kiss that lingers on his mind and, quite frankly, his lips. 

He still must resist the urge to touch them when he’s standing in front of his locker in school, settling for biting his lip instead when they start to tingle at the memory. 

Ned shakes his head, in what he’s not sure. Disapproval perhaps? He did tell him after all. 

“What?” He decides to ask finally, taking a step back and closing his locker.

“You’re head over heels and she’s taken. Not cool.”

“What? - I’m not-” but then he sees you at the other end of the hall and his words die in his throat entirely. 

He watches as you kiss your boyfriend, arms slung around his shoulders, while his hold you snugly by the waist. And when you part, he sees you smiling at him and it makes him look away, feeling like he’s intruding. 

Ned watches with a sympathetic smile, reaching out to pat him on the back. “Told you,” he whispers softly, turning his gaze away from Peter when he hears your heels approaching.

He gives you a meaningful look and a small nod before offering Peter another supportive pat and walking off, giving you some privacy. 

“Uh. Hi.”

“Hey,” you smile and reach into your backpack, pulling out his jacket. “Here. It’s washed.”

“Thanks.”

“No. Thank you for giving it to me.” You inhale softly, biting at your lower lip before dragging your eyes back to his. “Listen,” you begin, sounding so confident and uncomfortable at the same time. 

“What happened yesterday needs to stay between us, ok? I was pretty drunk and I- I don’t want it getting out. You understand, don’t you?”

“Uh. Yeah. Of course. Totally. I got it. My lips are sealed.”

Pairing: Peter Parker x fem!Reader

Word Count: ~2700

Warnings: Alcohol consumption. First kiss. 

(A/N): Still not dead, but getting there.

Summary: Let’s get drunk together so I can kiss you and then blame it on the vodka

“Oh, there we go again,” Ned sighs, watching Peter zone out and zero in on you. 

There was just something in the lighting surrounding you in that moment, that just caught his eye. 

The sunlight seemed to be hitting your face perfectly, framing your angled features in a ridiculously flattering way. 

Your skin looked warm to the touch, almost as if it was glowing, and he’d be lying if he said didn’t have the urge to stroke along your cheek, if only to test that theory. And, oh, your eyes. Still ever so effortlessly breathtaking and captivating. He wasn’t honestly sure if being that attractive was legal, let alone allowed on school premises.

He knew he was staring at you, but you didn’t seem bothered. You only propped your head on your fist, elbow resting on the table. And then you send him a lazy smile and amused little wink, taking his staring in stride before turning back to your companions at your table.

“Peter,” Ned sighs, clearing his throat, “Earth to Peter.” He waves his hand in front of the boy’s face, finally catching his attention. 

“Glad to see you’ve decided to join me in the present realm, buddy.”

Peter’s eyes widen momentarily, then he forcefully tears his eyes from you and the other cheerleaders and faces Ned. 

“Sorry, could you repeat that?”

“Which part? You were gone for like ten minutes.”

He makes a show of shoving Ned, snorting as Ned pushes him back with equal force.

“Anyway,” Ned clears his throat and moves to stand, motioning for Peter to do the same, “I was asking whether you were going to the party?”

“What party?” Peter furrows his brows, gripping at his bag and following Ned out the cafeteria. 

“Seriously?” The boy turns to send Peter an incredulous look over his shoulder. 

Peter nods, “Yes, that is the reason why you can hear confusion in my voice.” He motions to his face for emphasis. 

“Krista’s party? The one everyone was talking about for weeks? Does that ring a bell?”

“No?”

“You’re unbelievable.”

Peter shrugs, “I wasn’t going to go anyway.”

“Really? You were really going to miss the chance to spend some time with your sweet cheer-captain? That’s hard to-”

“She’s gonna be there?”

“Wow,” he shakes his head, “don’t even try to hide it, that’s cool,” a sigh and another shake of his head, “of course she’s going to be there. Everyone cooler than thou will. So, you going?”

“Well,” he rubs at the back of his neck, “a couple of hours wouldn’t hurt, would they?”

Ned grins, “and here I thought it’d be hard to change your mind.”

“Ok. Maybe coming here wasn’t such a good idea after all,” Peter gulps, hands reaching out to fumble at the collar of his jacket for the hundredth time in the past 5 minutes. 

Ned simply rolls his eyes, “Relax." 

"But-”

“No buts,” he pushes a drink into Peter’s hands, shoving him back towards the crowded living room, he gives up in the doorway, “you’ll be fine.”

“But she’s not here anyway and I really need to do my physics homework and-”

“You’re rambling. And she’s gonna show up. You know how her boyfriend is, he’s going to make a show of arriving late with her on his arm.”

“You know, reminding me of her boyfriend doesn’t help much.”

“Well, someone has to.”

“But-”

“You know what they say about the devil?” Ned motions to the door, watching as you appear in the doorway, your boyfriend straight behind you, shamelessly watching your ass. 

He isn’t the only one staring, but you take it all in stride once more, lips quirking into a smile. 

You give off the air of a queen then, charming and so unfairly gorgeous. No wonder people always seemed to flock to you.

And then you’re placing a chaste kiss onto your boyfriend’s cheek and walking towards the kitchen, towards him. 

You stop a few feet in front of Peter, smiling still.

And he wants to speak, to make everything less awkward, but what is he going to say? 

You look gorgeous? That would be stating the obvious. Something you must’ve heard at least a hundred times already today.

Something funny? Charming? Mr. Stark would be.

You arch a brow at him, smile curling into an amused little smirk, watching him open his mouth and close it again when nothing comes out. 

He falters for a moment, seemingly lost in thought and you can’t help but find it somewhat cute.

Great. He hasn’t even spoken to you yet and he’s already tongue tied.

“Hello- Uh, hi.” He manages finally, raising his hand and offering you an awkward little wave. “So,” he clears his throat, fumbling with his hands, “Come here often?”

His eyes widen slightly. Come here often? He wants to slap himself.

You snort- why is that so cute- and he feels like dying. Melting into the dirtied kitchen floor and evaporating into the atmosphere sounded great right about then.

“The kitchen? Why yes, whenever I want a drink.”

“The ki-” he turns his head so fast you’re surprised he doesn’t get a whiplash, noticing with horror that he’s been blocking the closest entry for the entire time, “Oh, I’m sorry! I didn’t-”

“I’m sure you didn’t,” you smile at him in a way that makes the sun look dull, it’s contagious. “Relax, Peter. You’ll live longer.”

And with that you move past him and into the kitchen, completely missing how Peter’s own smile stretches to an almost impossible length.

“Still wanna leave?” Ned quips from behind Peter, watching his best friend turn to face him with a grin of his own.

Peter ignores his question completely. “She knows my name!” His eyes widen as if he’s only now starting to fully register that fact. “How does- she knows my name!”

His hands rise to rest on his hair, an elated laugh escaping his lips. He’s sure Ned can hear his heart hammering against his rib cage over the booming music.

“She sure does,” Ned supplies amusedly, reaching out to switch out Peter’s cup with his own, “So, staying then?”

Peter nods, watching Ned outstretch his arm and meeting him halfway, clinking their plastic cups together. 

“Sweet cheeks, truth or dare?”

Flash smirks from the corner of the couch he stands leaning against. 

“Dare,” you smirk back, downing the remains of your cup, gladly accepting another one from one of the newer members of your cheer team. 

“I dare you,” Flash pauses, brows twitching in careful consideration before his eyes light up, “I dare you,” he repeats louder, more sure, “to get rid of your shirt and walk around in a bra for the rest of the party!”

Wolf whistles and cheers follow his dare and you roll your eyes, smirking still. 

“How do you know I’m even wearing a bra?” You arch a brow and watch Flash choke on his drink, some chuckles and giggles following your reply. 

Nevertheless, you give your cup to the closest jock for him to hold, fingers tugging at your shirt to pull it over your head. 

You throw it in Flash’s face, more whistles and laughter following as you reach for your cup again. 

“Alright, my turn.” You lick your lips and look around the room, eyes halting on Peter for a second, then two. Then two more, before moving on and stopping on your boyfriend. 

“Dear,” you begin teasingly, “truth or dare?”

“Dare,” he smirks, chugging down his own beverage before accepting a new bottle of beer from one of the jocks. 

“I dare you,” you allow one of the jocks to lean in and whisper something into your ear, “Sure,” you agree, “I dare you to strip and run a round around the block.”

His eyes light up with something akin to amusement? Peter’s not sure anymore in his own slightly buzzed state, and he begins stripping, stopping when he’s only in his boxers. 

“Completely?”

“Nah,” you wave him off, “wouldn’t want you to surrender your last shards of dignity so soon.”

He grins and marches to the door, confidently swinging it open and saluting before setting into a wobbly jog. 

“Well,” Flash grins, “who’s next?”

“Hey, have you seen-”

“Upstairs,” Ned motions up, smiling knowingly. 

“With-”

“No. I think he got lost. Maybe found a bush to sleep in?”

Peter nods, brows creasing in worry. “Is she alright?”

“Why wouldn’t she be?”

“Well, she’s been gone for pretty long.”

“Wow,” Ned raises his brows, “don’t even try to seem not totally creepy. Love it.”

Peter ignores his quip, repositioning the bottle of booze under his arm. “Maybe I should check on her?”

Ned shrugs, “You do you, bud.”

“I’m going.”

“Have fun.”

Peter nods absently, slowly pushing past the various party goers and wobbly making his way up the stairs. 

He doesn’t find you in the first two bedrooms, going for the third when he notices the open window to his left.

He steps forward and peeks outside, finding you sitting on the roof, looking at the stars. 

“Hey-” You turn to face him, and he falters for a moment, “Uh, would you like some company?”

“Sure,” you smile at him and he returns the gesture, carefully climbing out the window and joining you on the roof. 

“What are you doing on the roof anyway?”

“I wanted to get some fresh air.”

“On the roof?”

“Yup.” You pop the ‘p’ and Peter chuckles, a rush of hot affection bubbling up, wrapping itself around his heart, and he smiles. Of course, you did. 

“Well, it is beautiful.” He sneaks a quick look at you and watches your own smile widen in agreement. 

“Yeah, it is.”

Comfortable silence settles between the two of you, Peter occasionally shifting his eyes to your form whenever you decide to mouth along to the lyrics of whatever song is playing in the background.

“Hey, let’s play a game,” you pipe up after a while, suddenly turning and sitting cross-legged to face him directly. 

“A game?”

You giggle, and the sound makes something clench in his chest, not unpleasant, but noticeable and new. “That’s what I said.”

He answers with a smile, “What kind of game?”

“Never have I ever?“

"Never have I ever?” He repeats slowly, startling when you reach for his arm to take the bottle of cheap whiskey he took with.

“Yes,” you confirm, “you say something that you’ve never done and if I have done it, I’ll have to take a shot.”

“Here,” you open the now lukewarm bottle and smile, “I’ll go first. Never have I ever stolen something from a shop.”

“I’ve never.”

“Congratulations. Your turn.”

“Never have I ever,” he wrinkles his nose, eyes lighting up with an idea, “Never have I ever met anyone greater than Tony Stark.”

You huff incredulously, taking a big gulp. “You have met Tony Stark? Really?”

Peter nods enthusiastically. “Yeah, Mr. Stark and I worked together a couple of times. He’s awesome!”

“No doubt about that,” you agree. “Ok, my turn. Never have I ever gone skinny-dipping.”

“Never.”

“Somehow, not even surprised.”

“Never have I ever cheated on a test.”

“Wow, lay it on me,” you chuckle, taking another drink.

“Ok. Never have I ever jumped from a roof.”

Peter sheepishly reaches for the bottle, taking a big gulp.

“Seriously?” You wrinkle your nose at him.

“Hmm.”

“You’ll have to tell me about it sometime.”

Peter bites the inside of his cheek to keep from smiling too hard at the mention of a next time.

“Never have I ever driven while drunk.”

“Nope. I have never,” you raise your hands with a glint in your eyes, “and quite frankly I’m insulted you’d even think you’d get me with that.”

Peter chuckles bashfully.

“Ok. Hmm. Never have I ever been given a jacket when I was cold.”

“Are you cold?”

“Kinda?”

He drapes his jacket over you, smiling at you in his cute dopey way at the way the sleeves are far too big and you just kind of sink into it.

“Now you have.”

“You’re sweet.“

So are you. Somehow, he has enough self-awareness to not voice his thoughts out loud. So, instead, he takes a shot.

“It’s your turn.”

“Right,” he clears his throat, cheeks flushing, “never have I ever been kissed.”

Your eyebrows rise, and it may be the alcohol talking but goddamn you look even more stunning when you lean forward and pout in confusion. “Never?”

“Never.” He admits and the smile that follows takes his breath away. 

"Gotta say, I’m surprised.”

“Why?”

You shrug, taking a gulp. “I just thought someone as nice as you would have girls throwing themselves at him.” And after a beat, “And you’re pretty cute, you know?”

“Oh?” He’s flushed pink, unsure what to say. Heart hammering loud enough for you to hear it. He’s sure of it.

“Well,” you slowly crawl closer, reaching out to place a cool hand onto his cheek and turning his head to face you entirely, “it’s nothing that can’t be fixed.”

Does she mean-?

His eyes flutter shut when you lean in and kiss him, his hand cupping your jaw in a much too tender way. 

Oh, she does. And then all other semi-coherent thoughts leave him and he relaxes, feeling you smile against his mouth.

Your lips make his whole body feel warm, like he is sitting directly next to the sun. Your hand on his jaw feels cool though and the contrast is oddly intoxicating.

Your lips move against his smoothly, expertly, wonderfully. His trying to copy your motions, eager to learn. There’s no tongue- there’s nothing inherently sexual about the situation- but his heart is pounding, and his stomach is full of butterflies. 

He’s sure he’s blushing like mad by now and this time it has absolutely nothing to do with embarrassment. 

And then you’re gripping at the collar of his shirt and drawing him closer, dragging your thumb over cheek before releasing him from your spell and leaning back.

“Here you go,” you grin, “now you have.”

The rest of the night goes by in a blur, but it’s the kiss that lingers on his mind and, quite frankly, his lips. 

He still must resist the urge to touch them when he’s standing in front of his locker in school, settling for biting his lip instead when they start to tingle at the memory. 

Ned shakes his head, in what he’s not sure. Disapproval perhaps? He did tell him after all. 

“What?” He decides to ask finally, taking a step back and closing his locker.

“You’re head over heels and she’s taken. Not cool.”

“What? - I’m not-” but then he sees you at the other end of the hall and his words die in his throat entirely. 

He watches as you kiss your boyfriend, arms slung around his shoulders, while his hold you snugly by the waist. And when you part, he sees you smiling at him and it makes him look away, feeling like he’s intruding. 

Ned watches with a sympathetic smile, reaching out to pat him on the back. “Told you,” he whispers softly, turning his gaze away from Peter when he hears your heels approaching.

He gives you a meaningful look and a small nod before offering Peter another supportive pat and walking off, giving you some privacy. 

“Uh. Hi.”

“Hey,” you smile and reach into your backpack, pulling out his jacket. “Here. It’s washed.”

“Thanks.”

“No. Thank you for giving it to me.” You inhale softly, biting at your lower lip before dragging your eyes back to his. “Listen,” you begin, sounding so confident and uncomfortable at the same time. 

“What happened yesterday needs to stay between us, ok? I was pretty drunk and I- I don’t want it getting out. You understand, don’t you?”

“Uh. Yeah. Of course. Totally. I got it. My lips are sealed.”

He makes a motion of zipping his lips and throwing away the key. You giggle gently and he’d be lying if he didn’t feel his heart breaking.

“Thank you, Peter.”

“Of course,” you turn to walk away, “[Y/N]?”

You turn back to face him, tilting your head in question, and somehow all courage leaves him again and he raises his jacket a little higher and smiles awkwardly. “Thanks again. For the jacket, I mean.”

“Don’t mention it.” And with that you turn and disappear in the crowd and Peter has to bite the inside of his cheek again.

This time though to keep from crying.

Foolish boy, to think that something that started with a kiss would end with one.

Your lips move against his smoothly, expertly, wonderfully. His trying to copy your motions, eager to learn. There’s no tongue- there’s nothing inherently sexual about the situation- but his heart is pounding, and his stomach is full of butterflies. 

He’s sure he’s blushing like mad by now and this time it has absolutely nothing to do with embarrassment. 

And then you’re gripping at the collar of his shirt and drawing him closer, dragging your thumb over cheek before releasing him from your spell and leaning back.

“Here you go,” you grin, “now you have.”

The rest of the night goes by in a blur, but it’s the kiss that lingers on his mind and, quite frankly, his lips. 

He still must resist the urge to touch them when he’s standing in front of his locker in school, settling for biting his lip instead when they start to tingle at the memory. 

Ned shakes his head, in what he’s not sure. Disapproval perhaps? He did tell him after all. 

“What?” He decides to ask finally, taking a step back and closing his locker.

“You’re head over heels and she’s taken. Not cool.”

“What? - I’m not-” but then he sees you at the other end of the hall and his words die in his throat entirely. 

He watches as you kiss your boyfriend, arms slung around his shoulders, while his hold you snugly by the waist. And when you part, he sees you smiling at him and it makes him look away, feeling like he’s intruding. 

Ned watches with a sympathetic smile, reaching out to pat him on the back. “Told you,” he whispers softly, turning his gaze away from Peter when he hears your heels approaching.

He gives you a meaningful look and a small nod before offering Peter another supportive pat and walking off, giving you some privacy. 

“Uh. Hi.”

“Hey,” you smile and reach into your backpack, pulling out his jacket. “Here. It’s washed.”

“Thanks.”

“No. Thank you for giving it to me.” You inhale softly, biting at your lower lip before dragging your eyes back to his. “Listen,” you begin, sounding so confident and uncomfortable at the same time. 

“What happened yesterday needs to stay between us, ok? I was pretty drunk and I- I don’t want it getting out. You understand, don’t you?”

“Uh. Yeah. Of course. Totally. I got it. My lips are sealed.”

He makes a motion of zipping his lips and throwing away the key. You giggle gently and he’d be lying if he didn’t feel his heart breaking.

“Thank you, Peter.”

“Of course,” you turn to walk away, “[Y/N]?”

You turn back to face him, tilting your head in question, and somehow all courage leaves him again and he raises his jacket a little higher and smiles awkwardly. “Thanks again. For the jacket, I mean.”

“Don’t mention it.” And with that you turn and disappear in the crowd and Peter has to bite the inside of his cheek again.

This time though to keep from crying.

Pairing: Peter Parker x fem!Reader

Word Count: ~2700

Warnings: Alcohol consumption. First kiss. 

(A/N): Still not dead, but getting there.

Summary: Let’s get drunk together so I can kiss you and then blame it on the vodka

“Oh, there we go again,” Ned sighs, watching Peter zone out and zero in on you. 

There was just something in the lighting surrounding you in that moment, that just caught his eye. 

The sunlight seemed to be hitting your face perfectly, framing your angled features in a ridiculously flattering way. 

Your skin looked warm to the touch, almost as if it was glowing, and he’d be lying if he said didn’t have the urge to stroke along your cheek, if only to test that theory. And, oh, your eyes. Still ever so effortlessly breathtaking and captivating. He wasn’t honestly sure if being that attractive was legal, let alone allowed on school premises.

He knew he was staring at you, but you didn’t seem bothered. You only propped your head on your fist, elbow resting on the table. And then you send him a lazy smile and amused little wink, taking his staring in stride before turning back to your companions at your table.

“Peter,” Ned sighs, clearing his throat, “Earth to Peter.” He waves his hand in front of the boy’s face, finally catching his attention. 

“Glad to see you’ve decided to join me in the present realm, buddy.”

Peter’s eyes widen momentarily, then he forcefully tears his eyes from you and the other cheerleaders and faces Ned. 

“Sorry, could you repeat that?”

“Which part? You were gone for like ten minutes.”

He makes a show of shoving Ned, snorting as Ned pushes him back with equal force.

“Anyway,” Ned clears his throat and moves to stand, motioning for Peter to do the same, “I was asking whether you were going to the party?”

“What party?” Peter furrows his brows, gripping at his bag and following Ned out the cafeteria. 

“Seriously?” The boy turns to send Peter an incredulous look over his shoulder. 

Peter nods, “Yes, that is the reason why you can hear confusion in my voice.” He motions to his face for emphasis. 

“Krista’s party? The one everyone was talking about for weeks? Does that ring a bell?”

“No?”

“You’re unbelievable.”

Peter shrugs, “I wasn’t going to go anyway.”

“Really? You were really going to miss the chance to spend some time with your sweet cheer-captain? That’s hard to-”

“She’s gonna be there?”

“Wow,” he shakes his head, “don’t even try to hide it, that’s cool,” a sigh and another shake of his head, “of course she’s going to be there. Everyone cooler than thou will. So, you going?”

“Well,” he rubs at the back of his neck, “a couple of hours wouldn’t hurt, would they?”

Ned grins, “and here I thought it’d be hard to change your mind.”

“Ok. Maybe coming here wasn’t such a good idea after all,” Peter gulps, hands reaching out to fumble at the collar of his jacket for the hundredth time in the past 5 minutes. 

Ned simply rolls his eyes, “Relax." 

"But-”

“No buts,” he pushes a drink into Peter’s hands, shoving him back towards the crowded living room, he gives up in the doorway, “you’ll be fine.”

“But she’s not here anyway and I really need to do my physics homework and-”

“You’re rambling. And she’s gonna show up. You know how her boyfriend is, he’s going to make a show of arriving late with her on his arm.”

“You know, reminding me of her boyfriend doesn’t help much.”

“Well, someone has to.”

“But-”

“You know what they say about the devil?” Ned motions to the door, watching as you appear in the doorway, your boyfriend straight behind you, shamelessly watching your ass. 

He isn’t the only one staring, but you take it all in stride once more, lips quirking into a smile. 

You give off the air of a queen then, charming and so unfairly gorgeous. No wonder people always seemed to flock to you.

And then you’re placing a chaste kiss onto your boyfriend’s cheek and walking towards the kitchen, towards him. 

You stop a few feet in front of Peter, smiling still.

And he wants to speak, to make everything less awkward, but what is he going to say? 

You look gorgeous? That would be stating the obvious. Something you must’ve heard at least a hundred times already today.

Something funny? Charming? Mr. Stark would be.

You arch a brow at him, smile curling into an amused little smirk, watching him open his mouth and close it again when nothing comes out. 

He falters for a moment, seemingly lost in thought and you can’t help but find it somewhat cute.

Great. He hasn’t even spoken to you yet and he’s already tongue tied.

“Hello- Uh, hi.” He manages finally, raising his hand and offering you an awkward little wave. “So,” he clears his throat, fumbling with his hands, “Come here often?”

His eyes widen slightly. Come here often? He wants to slap himself.

You snort- why is that so cute- and he feels like dying. Melting into the dirtied kitchen floor and evaporating into the atmosphere sounded great right about then.

“The kitchen? Why yes, whenever I want a drink.”

“The ki-” he turns his head so fast you’re surprised he doesn’t get a whiplash, noticing with horror that he’s been blocking the closest entry for the entire time, “Oh, I’m sorry! I didn’t-”

“I’m sure you didn’t,” you smile at him in a way that makes the sun look dull, it’s contagious. “Relax, Peter. You’ll live longer.”

And with that you move past him and into the kitchen, completely missing how Peter’s own smile stretches to an almost impossible length.

“Still wanna leave?” Ned quips from behind Peter, watching his best friend turn to face him with a grin of his own.

Peter ignores his question completely. “She knows my name!” His eyes widen as if he’s only now starting to fully register that fact. “How does- she knows my name!”

His hands rise to rest on his hair, an elated laugh escaping his lips. He’s sure Ned can hear his heart hammering against his rib cage over the booming music.

“She sure does,” Ned supplies amusedly, reaching out to switch out Peter’s cup with his own, “So, staying then?”

Peter nods, watching Ned outstretch his arm and meeting him halfway, clinking their plastic cups together. 

“Sweet cheeks, truth or dare?”

Flash smirks from the corner of the couch he stands leaning against. 

“Dare,” you smirk back, downing the remains of your cup, gladly accepting another one from one of the newer members of your cheer team. 

“I dare you,” Flash pauses, brows twitching in careful consideration before his eyes light up, “I dare you,” he repeats louder, more sure, “to get rid of your shirt and walk around in a bra for the rest of the party!”

Wolf whistles and cheers follow his dare and you roll your eyes, smirking still. 

“How do you know I’m even wearing a bra?” You arch a brow and watch Flash choke on his drink, some chuckles and giggles following your reply. 

Nevertheless, you give your cup to the closest jock for him to hold, fingers tugging at your shirt to pull it over your head. 

You throw it in Flash’s face, more whistles and laughter following as you reach for your cup again. 

“Alright, my turn.” You lick your lips and look around the room, eyes halting on Peter for a second, then two. Then two more, before moving on and stopping on your boyfriend. 

“Dear,” you begin teasingly, “truth or dare?”

“Dare,” he smirks, chugging down his own beverage before accepting a new bottle of beer from one of the jocks. 

“I dare you,” you allow one of the jocks to lean in and whisper something into your ear, “Sure,” you agree, “I dare you to strip and run a round around the block.”

His eyes light up with something akin to amusement? Peter’s not sure anymore in his own slightly buzzed state, and he begins stripping, stopping when he’s only in his boxers. 

“Completely?”

“Nah,” you wave him off, “wouldn’t want you to surrender your last shards of dignity so soon.”

He grins and marches to the door, confidently swinging it open and saluting before setting into a wobbly jog. 

“Well,” Flash grins, “who’s next?”

“Hey, have you seen-”

“Upstairs,” Ned motions up, smiling knowingly. 

“With-”

“No. I think he got lost. Maybe found a bush to sleep in?”

Peter nods, brows creasing in worry. “Is she alright?”

“Why wouldn’t she be?”

“Well, she’s been gone for pretty long.”

“Wow,” Ned raises his brows, “don’t even try to seem not totally creepy. Love it.”

Peter ignores his quip, repositioning the bottle of booze under his arm. “Maybe I should check on her?”

Ned shrugs, “You do you, bud.”

“I’m going.”

“Have fun.”

Peter nods absently, slowly pushing past the various party goers and wobbly making his way up the stairs. 

He doesn’t find you in the first two bedrooms, going for the third when he notices the open window to his left.

He steps forward and peeks outside, finding you sitting on the roof, looking at the stars. 

“Hey-” You turn to face him, and he falters for a moment, “Uh, would you like some company?”

“Sure,” you smile at him and he returns the gesture, carefully climbing out the window and joining you on the roof. 

“What are you doing on the roof anyway?”

“I wanted to get some fresh air.”

“On the roof?”

“Yup.” You pop the ‘p’ and Peter chuckles, a rush of hot affection bubbling up, wrapping itself around his heart, and he smiles. Of course, you did. 

“Well, it is beautiful.” He sneaks a quick look at you and watches your own smile widen in agreement. 

“Yeah, it is.”

Comfortable silence settles between the two of you, Peter occasionally shifting his eyes to your form whenever you decide to mouth along to the lyrics of whatever song is playing in the background.

“Hey, let’s play a game,” you pipe up after a while, suddenly turning and sitting cross-legged to face him directly. 

“A game?”

You giggle, and the sound makes something clench in his chest, not unpleasant, but noticeable and new. “That’s what I said.”

He answers with a smile, “What kind of game?”

“Never have I ever?“

"Never have I ever?” He repeats slowly, startling when you reach for his arm to take the bottle of cheap whiskey he took with.

“Yes,” you confirm, “you say something that you’ve never done and if I have done it, I’ll have to take a shot.”

“Here,” you open the now lukewarm bottle and smile, “I’ll go first. Never have I ever stolen something from a shop.”

“I’ve never.”

“Congratulations. Your turn.”

“Never have I ever,” he wrinkles his nose, eyes lighting up with an idea, “Never have I ever met anyone greater than Tony Stark.”

You huff incredulously, taking a big gulp. “You have met Tony Stark? Really?”

Peter nods enthusiastically. “Yeah, Mr. Stark and I worked together a couple of times. He’s awesome!”

“No doubt about that,” you agree. “Ok, my turn. Never have I ever gone skinny-dipping.”

“Never.”

“Somehow, not even surprised.”

“Never have I ever cheated on a test.”

“Wow, lay it on me,” you chuckle, taking another drink.

“Ok. Never have I ever jumped from a roof.”

Peter sheepishly reaches for the bottle, taking a big gulp.

“Seriously?” You wrinkle your nose at him.

“Hmm.”

“You’ll have to tell me about it sometime.”

Peter bites the inside of his cheek to keep from smiling too hard at the mention of a next time.

“Never have I ever driven while drunk.”

“Nope. I have never,” you raise your hands with a glint in your eyes, “and quite frankly I’m insulted you’d even think you’d get me with that.”

Peter chuckles bashfully.

“Ok. Hmm. Never have I ever been given a jacket when I was cold.”

“Are you cold?”

“Kinda?”

He drapes his jacket over you, smiling at you in his cute dopey way at the way the sleeves are far too big and you just kind of sink into it.

“Now you have.”

“You’re sweet.“

So are you. Somehow, he has enough self-awareness to not voice his thoughts out loud. So, instead, he takes a shot.

“It’s your turn.”

“Right,” he clears his throat, cheeks flushing, “never have I ever been kissed.”

Your eyebrows rise, and it may be the alcohol talking but goddamn you look even more stunning when you lean forward and pout in confusion. “Never?”

“Never.” He admits and the smile that follows takes his breath away. 

"Gotta say, I’m surprised.”

“Why?”

You shrug, taking a gulp. “I just thought someone as nice as you would have girls throwing themselves at him.” And after a beat, “And you’re pretty cute, you know?”

“Oh?” He’s flushed pink, unsure what to say. Heart hammering loud enough for you to hear it. He’s sure of it.

“Well,” you slowly crawl closer, reaching out to place a cool hand onto his cheek and turning his head to face you entirely, “it’s nothing that can’t be fixed.”

Does she mean-?

His eyes flutter shut when you lean in and kiss him, his hand cupping your jaw in a much too tender way. 

Oh, she does. And then all other semi-coherent thoughts leave him and he relaxes, feeling you smile against his mouth.

Your lips make his whole body feel warm, like he is sitting directly next to the sun. Your hand on his jaw feels cool though and the contrast is oddly intoxicating.

title: Needed Nurture
body:
Ooooof, been working on this for a bit, but a lil hurt/comfort fic for Norman and secretary, because some angst was a long time coming with the poor bab 😮❤️

Anyway enjoy! 😊

“They’re insane.” Norman kneaded his forehead, before letting go and broadly gesturing in exasperation. “Absolutely insane!”

Chloe just about missed his dramatic gesturing by jolting back a bit in her chair, clutching her coffee mug. She set it back down on her coaster and held her chin thoughtfully.

“They sound it.” She reaffirmed, nodding in some confidence. “That prototype sounds way too big a deal to be done by next week. You sure they won’t let you have more time?”

Norman scoffed. “Oh god no, those pompous pea-brained idiots won’t let me have a single second overtime, not if they can help it.”

It was Chloe’s turn to gesture in confusion, as she lazily shrugged and squinted her eyes, as though trying to process and make sense of it all. “But you’ve done so much for them! They really can’t be convinced?”

Norman shook his head firmly. “Not a chance in hell! They want me to slip up, I just know it. They’ve never liked my own projects, if they could have their way, they’d like me to just screw it all up and to give them an excuse to move on, and find some new team to do their dirty work for them.” Norman continued to gesture as he spoke, impassioned by his rant. It was clear that these were feelings he’d repressed yet recounted to himself for years, and now he had someone to bounce them off of, he was going full throttle with it.

He let out another scoff as he sat there, collecting his thoughts before he continued. “Even then, they’d just repeat themselves when they got sick of them too.”

Chloe shook her head disappointed, as she took it all in. “That’s horrible.”

“That’s business.” Norman shrugged and sighed. “There’s no room for pure innovation and progress.”

Chloe couldn’t always keep up with his rants, and she couldn’t help but doubt it was just this black and white. But Norman was so frustrated, she’d absolutely let him get everything off his chest.

“Besides,” Norman continued, “I think they know that negotiating isn’t my strong suit anyway. That’s why they think they can get away with it.”

Chloe raised her brow, surprised by that notion. “Ahh what? You’re great with negotiations, I hear you making deals on the phone all the time.”

With another weak shrug of his shoulders, Norman responded with a tinge of melancholy to his voice, “With the right people, ones who were going to agree with whatever deal I threw their way anyway. No, when I have to try, I rarely ever get it right.”

“Well, I doubt that.” Chloe said, smiling sympathetically at him. She’d not seen Norman speak of himself like this before, but she wanted to try and lift him before he had the chance to get anymore down about himself. But as Norman shot her a sarcastic smirk, she grew worried.

“Yeah well, you’ve been here for what, a few months?” He snapped at her, making Chloe feel a bit sheepish. The feeling subsided quickly however, as Norman’s smarmy look faded and he just looked dejected. He leant back into his chair, with his head down solemnly. “No, if you were with the company for even a year at least, then you’d see that I fail at negotiations far more than succeed.”

Chloe didn’t know what to say. She still doubted he was anywhere near as bad as he thought, but that was the thing, even in all these chats and little rants from him, he never showed this side to him, this especially vulnerable side. Before she could respond, Norman continued. “What kind of businessman am I really? I can’t even convince some desperate investor to give me just a little more time? I feel like a failure.”

“You are not a failure!” Chloe insisted, suddenly growing more firm.

“I am, Chloe.” Norman didn’t look up to her, he still looked to be relishing in his negative thoughts. Finally, he chuckled weakly and shook his head slowly. “God, I don’t know why I’m telling you all of this. You’re my secretary, of course you’d just say anything even a little supportive of me. I’m an idiot for expecting you to care really.”

“What?” More and more, Chloe’s shy barrier broke apart as she grew more concerned and frustrated. “I care about you, Norman!”

“Hmm, you would tell me that though, wouldn’t you?” Norman barely looked to her, before he returned to just looking down at his lap. It was as if he didn’t even have the energy to lift his head anymore. “I know you’re too polite to let me know how much of an idiot I sound, rambling to you like this.

Chloe had heard more than enough, she wasn’t going to listen to her friend bad mouth himself anymore.

“Norman.” As he continued to slump forward, Chloe placed her hand over his and squeezed it gently. The sudden contact made Norman finally look towards her, as she placed her other hand underneath his, and massaged it with her fingers. “You are NOT an idiot. And especially not for telling me how you feel. You’re one of the smartest, and strongest, and sweetest people I know. And it’s really awful you think that bad of yourself in any way, because you’re such an amazing man, Norman Osborn.”

As he processed her words, Norman took a few moments before he turned his chair towards her fully. She took his other hand in hers and massaged the both of them. Norman looked down to their hands before returning his gaze to her, still depressed, but quizzical now.

“You think all that about me really?”

Chloe nodded and smiled, still holding his hands. “Yes! All that and loads more! And it sounds like you don’t get told that enough.”

Norman felt his heart swell as he looked to Chloe and listened to her. A part of him still couldn’t believe what she was telling him, but at the same time, he felt he could trust her, that maybe it was all true. “I’ve never been told anything like that. Not for a very long time anyway.” He could feel himself beginning to smile finally. “Thank you, Chloe.”

Chloe shook her curly head and beamed at him. “It’s more than ok!”

As much as Norman would have liked to stop there and not give anymore of himself away, he found himself continuing anyway. “I am sorry for snapping at you too. I guess I’ve not gotten much sleep lately either. Things on my mind. My work, my family’s problems, my own …”

He sighed and looked down to his desk, trying to avert his eyes. He could feel them beginning to water. “I’m just so tired.”

His aversion didn’t work at all, as Chloe saw the shine from his eyes. Her heart hurt from seeing her friend so upset, and while she knew what she was about to do was inappropriate, being his employee especially, she just couldn’t help herself, he needed it. She got up from her chair and wrapped her arms around Norman, taking him in for a tight hug.

Norman nearly felt shocked out of his upset state through that alone, as his body stiffened and his face heated up. He hadn’t had such a big hug in so long, especially not from a woman. Or from an employee, for that matter. But at this moment, it did feel so comforting to have his new friend take him into her embrace. He found himself sinking into the hug and he wrapped an arm around Chloe’s back, rubbing it softly. Neither spoke for a few moments, until Chloe finally broke the silence.

“Definitely get lots of rest tonight, Norman, just try. In the morning you can come back to the problem, all freshened up. And I’ll help, if you’d like!”

Norman chuckled and pulled back his arm, signalling he was done with the hug. As Chloe let go, he looked to her as she still stood in front of his chair.

“There isn’t a lot you can do, no offence. Unless you carry a degree, I don’t know about?” Norman’s eyes were still a bit red from a few stray tears, but his cheeky smirk was genuine as he joked. Chloe felt so glad he was looking a bit better, and she played along with a big shrug.

“I dunno! Unless I carry a degree even I don’t know about!” She mock gasped, as Norman grinned.

“Even with that imaginary one, you’d have more than all those investors put together.” He chuckled at the jab, it felt cathartic after everything.

“Yeah true!” Chloe laughed before sitting back down again. “But if I can do anything at all, I will!” She sat up straight and with confidence, to prove her point that she was dependable. It made Norman smile to see this, he wasn’t used to seeing someone at his work be so plucky.

“You’ve done more than enough for now, Chloe. But thank you. Thank you for the kind words and the … the hug.” Norman paused as he tried not to blush again, remembering the shock, the warmth and the safety of the cuddle.

He hardly needed to worry about embarrassing himself however, as Chloe was giggling and blushing herself; shrugging her shoulders and brushing her skirt sheepishly. “That’s ok. You just looked like you needed one.”

Norman smiled at the bashful woman, and responded honestly. “I did, I think I really did.”

“Besides,” Norman continued, “I think they know that negotiating isn’t my strong suit anyway. That’s why they think they can get away with it.”

Chloe raised her brow, surprised by that notion. “Ahh what? You’re great with negotiations, I hear you making deals on the phone all the time.”

With another weak shrug of his shoulders, Norman responded with a tinge of melancholy to his voice, “With the right people, ones who were going to agree with whatever deal I threw their way anyway. No, when I have to try, I rarely ever get it right.”

“Well, I doubt that.” Chloe said, smiling sympathetically at him. She’d not seen Norman speak of himself like this before, but she wanted to try and lift him before he had the chance to get anymore down about himself. But as Norman shot her a sarcastic smirk, she grew worried.

“Yeah well, you’ve been here for what, a few months?” He snapped at her, making Chloe feel a bit sheepish. The feeling subsided quickly however, as Norman’s smarmy look faded and he just looked dejected. He leant back into his chair, with his head down solemnly. “No, if you were with the company for even a year at least, then you’d see that I fail at negotiations far more than succeed.”

Chloe didn’t know what to say. She still doubted he was anywhere near as bad as he thought, but that was the thing, even in all these chats and little rants from him, he never showed this side to him, this especially vulnerable side. Before she could respond, Norman continued. “What kind of businessman am I really? I can’t even convince some desperate investor to give me just a little more time? I feel like a failure.”

“You are not a failure!” Chloe insisted, suddenly growing more firm.

“I am, Chloe.” Norman didn’t look up to her, he still looked to be relishing in his negative thoughts. Finally, he chuckled weakly and shook his head slowly. “God, I don’t know why I’m telling you all of this. You’re my secretary, of course you’d just say anything even a little supportive of me. I’m an idiot for expecting you to care really.”

“What?” More and more, Chloe’s shy barrier broke apart as she grew more concerned and frustrated. “I care about you, Norman!”

“Hmm, you would tell me that though, wouldn’t you?” Norman barely looked to her, before he returned to just looking down at his lap. It was as if he didn’t even have the energy to lift his head anymore. “I know you’re too polite to let me know how much of an idiot I sound, rambling to you like this.

Chloe had heard more than enough, she wasn’t going to listen to her friend bad mouth himself anymore.

“Norman.” As he continued to slump forward, Chloe placed her hand over his and squeezed it gently. The sudden contact made Norman finally look towards her, as she placed her other hand underneath his, and massaged it with her fingers. “You are NOT an idiot. And especially not for telling me how you feel. You’re one of the smartest, and strongest, and sweetest people I know. And it’s really awful you think that bad of yourself in any way, because you’re such an amazing man, Norman Osborn.”

As he processed her words, Norman took a few moments before he turned his chair towards her fully. She took his other hand in hers and massaged the both of them. Norman looked down to their hands before returning his gaze to her, still depressed, but quizzical now.

“You think all that about me really?”

Chloe nodded and smiled, still holding his hands. “Yes! All that and loads more! And it sounds like you don’t get told that enough.”

Norman felt his heart swell as he looked to Chloe and listened to her. A part of him still couldn’t believe what she was telling him, but at the same time, he felt he could trust her, that maybe it was all true. “I’ve never been told anything like that. Not for a very long time anyway.” He could feel himself beginning to smile finally. “Thank you, Chloe.”

Chloe shook her curly head and beamed at him. “It’s more than ok!”

As much as Norman would have liked to stop there and not give anymore of himself away, he found himself continuing anyway. “I am sorry for snapping at you too. I guess I’ve not gotten much sleep lately either. Things on my mind. My work, my family’s problems, my own …”

He sighed and looked down to his desk, trying to avert his eyes. He could feel them beginning to water. “I’m just so tired.”

His aversion didn’t work at all, as Chloe saw the shine from his eyes. Her heart hurt from seeing her friend so upset, and while she knew what she was about to do was inappropriate, being his employee especially, she just couldn’t help herself, he needed it. She got up from her chair and wrapped her arms around Norman, taking him in for a tight hug.

Norman nearly felt shocked out of his upset state through that alone, as his body stiffened and his face heated up. He hadn’t had such a big hug in so long, especially not from a woman. Or from an employee, for that matter. But at this moment, it did feel so comforting to have his new friend take him into her embrace. He found himself sinking into the hug and he wrapped an arm around Chloe’s back, rubbing it softly. Neither spoke for a few moments, until Chloe finally broke the silence.

“Definitely get lots of rest tonight, Norman, just try. In the morning you can come back to the problem, all freshened up. And I’ll help, if you’d like!”

Norman chuckled and pulled back his arm, signalling he was done with the hug. As Chloe let go, he looked to her as she still stood in front of his chair.

“There isn’t a lot you can do, no offence. Unless you carry a degree, I don’t know about?” Norman’s eyes were still a bit red from a few stray tears, but his cheeky smirk was genuine as he joked. Chloe felt so glad he was looking a bit better, and she played along with a big shrug.

“I dunno! Unless I carry a degree even I don’t know about!” She mock gasped, as Norman grinned.

“Even with that imaginary one, you’d have more than all those investors put together.” He chuckled at the jab, it felt cathartic after everything.

“Yeah true!” Chloe laughed before sitting back down again. “But if I can do anything at all, I will!” She sat up straight and with confidence, to prove her point that she was dependable. It made Norman smile to see this, he wasn’t used to seeing someone at his work be so plucky.

“You’ve done more than enough for now, Chloe. But thank you. Thank you for the kind words and the … the hug.” Norman paused as he tried not to blush again, remembering the shock, the warmth and the safety of the cuddle.

He hardly needed to worry about embarrassing himself however, as Chloe was giggling and blushing herself; shrugging her shoulders and brushing her skirt sheepishly. “That’s ok. You just looked like you needed one.”

Norman smiled at the bashful woman, and responded honestly. “I did, I think I really did.”
